_comment: Created by ianb on 01/10/2014 11:54:22 using v2.1
title: Is the number of calls responsible for the standard breach in the month?
analysis_commentary:
By mapping the national performance of the eight minute target against the volume of calls we can establish whether increased call volume can account for declines in performance . According to the limited amount of data available for previous years, there appears to be a marginal inverse relationship between the total number of calls and the percentage that can be responded to within the eight minutes.

This chart and those discussed above indicate that the total number of calls is not the sole reason for below target performance in a given month. Breaches are not always associated with increased call activity and increased call activity doesn't always result in a breach. To better understand this issue further investigation of potential causes would be needed.

Updated March 2017.
data_source: NHS England, Ambulance Quality Indicators: System Indicators
